alert.note: Alert for Boone; Logan; Mingo; Northwest Raleigh; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 4:34AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Mingo, west central Raleigh, southeastern Logan, northwestern Wyoming and southeastern Boone Counties through 500 AM EDT... At 433 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Man, or 12 miles southeast of Logan, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pineville, Oceana, Man, Mallory, Amherstdale-Robinette, Twin Falls State Park, Bald Knob, R.d. Bailey Lake, Gilbert Creek, Gilbert, Clear Fork, Cyclone, Coal Mountain, Bruno, Kopperston, Stickney and Amherstdale-Robine. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Logan; Mingo; Northwest Raleigh; Wyoming
